verbose_text: The main finding of the study, that set out to mirror a real world setting where individuals buy meal replacements from a supermarket or pharmacy, was that consumption of 2 meal replacements for 3 months and 1 meal replacement for a further 3 months led to greater weight loss of approximately 2 kg (5%) and a 0.11% decrease in HbA1c compared with control subjects who used a commercially available weight loss book.
